items.title: Reliance Industries to declare Q2 results on October 14
items.description: Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) will hold a board meeting on October 14 to review the financial results for the quarter ending September 2024. The company previously reported a 5% decline in net profit for the first quarter of June 2024. A presentation to analysts and media will follow the meeting.

items.title: Investors can now access 100% of sale proceeds for same-day trading
items.description: Starting Monday, investors will receive 100% of their sale proceeds on the same day, enabling immediate reinvestment. Previously, only 80% was accessible the same day with the rest available later. This change, aimed at enhancing liquidity, will benefit trading activities significantly.

items.title: Market Trading Guide: IOC, AstraZeneca among 4 stock recommendations for Tuesday
items.description: Domestic headline indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, gave up early gains to end lower for the sixth consecutive session on Monday, pressured by rising Middle East tensions and concerns over a weaker corporate earnings outlook. The 30-share BSE Sensex dropped 638 points, or 0.78%, to settle at 81,050, while the broader NSE Nifty declined 218 points, or 0.87%, to finish at 24,795.he next couple of weeks. Immediate support is at 26000," said Nagaraj Shetti, Senior Technical Research Analyst at HDFC Securities."Nifty slipped further due to ongoing geopolitical concerns, with sentiment worsening as the index fell below the 55-EMA, indicating a bearish trend. A bearish crossover in the RSI is adding to the downward price momentum. In the short term, the trend may remain volatile, with a predominantly bearish outlook," Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities said. Overall, the market appears to be ‘sell on rise’ as long as it stays below 25,000 while on the downside, the support levels are positioned at 25,700-25,590/25,400, De said.Here are 4 stock recommendations for Tuesday:

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock action on Tuesday
items.description: Indian indices extended their losing streak for the sixth consecutive session, dragged by corporate earnings concerns and Middle East tensions. Nifty fell 0.87% to 24,795, and Sensex dropped 0.78%. Analyst Rupak De sees a bearish trend, with support at 25,400. Jatin Gedia sees a short-term target of 24,500.

items.title: HDFC Bank divests 100% stake in HDFC Edu for Rs 192 crore
items.description: India's largest private sector lender HDFC Bank on Monday said that its board has approved 100% stake sale of subsidiary HDFC Education to Vama Sundari Investments in an all-cash deal amounting to Rs 192 crore. The sale price is Rs. 9.60 per share.

items.title: These 5 stocks hit 52-week highs, rallied up to 25% in a month
items.description: Sensex fell by 638 points on Monday, ending at 81,050. Despite this, five stocks in the BSE 500 index hit their 52-week highs. These highs indicate strong performance and potential for future growth.

items.title: US stocks open lower as changing rate expectations boost yields
items.description: Wall Street's main indexes fell at the open on Monday, pressured by a rally in Treasury yields as investors dialed back bets on the scope of the Federal Reserve interest rate cuts this year.

items.title: Only if you have the ability to be tactical, contrarian & nimble-footed. 7 IT stocks with an upside potential of up to 34% in 1 year
items.description: The outperformance of metal stocks and the indices is well known. But it is worth noting the performance of a number of IT stocks. They have not suffered the kind of cuts other sectors and stocks have witnessed. This is interesting if you take into account the fact that the Q2 earning season will be kicked off by large-cap IT companies. Going by what their managements have been saying, don’t expect major positive surprises. So what explains this relatively strong outperformance? And does it present an opportunity for short-term tactical trades or investments?

items.title: FIIs sell Indian equities worth Rs 8,293 crore on Monday
items.description: FIIs sold Indian equities worth Rs 8,293.41 crore on Monday, while DIIs were net buyers at Rs 13,245.12 crore. Indian indices fell for the sixth consecutive session, with Nifty Bank, Nifty Metal, Nifty Oil & Gas, and Nifty PSU Bank falling over 2%.

items.title: Vodafone Idea, Tata Chemicals among 5 stocks with long unwinding
items.description: Long unwinding refers to the selling of positions or stocks owned for a longer period either to book profit or to exit it in anticipation of impending bearishness. In Monday's trading session, five stocks witnessed a long unwinding. Here's the list:

items.title: Ashish Kacholia buys fresh stake in this smallcap company, stock up 5%
items.description: Ace investor Ashish Kacholia bought a 2.52% stake in Jyoti Structures. The stock closed 4.8% higher. Promoters and the promoter group do not hold any stake in the company. The entire 100% stake is held by public shareholders like FPIs, AIFs, and insurance companies.

items.title: NSE share price jumps up to 45% in 3-4 months on IPO buzz. Will the uptrend continue?
items.description: NSE's IPO buzz has grown in the last 3-4 months, leading to a 35% rise in its share price in the unlisted market. Investors are waiting for the listing due to the stock's promise and higher premium compared to the current market price.

items.title: Tech view: Nifty breaks crucial support, may slide to 24,500 level. How to trade tomorrow
items.description: Nifty formed a long bear candle, indicating a continuation of the downtrend. The positive chart pattern has been negated by Nifty moving below the 24,753 support level. The underlying trend remains negative, with support at 24,500-24,400.

items.title: In Charts: New age tech stocks surge in CY24. Check their financials & institutional data
items.description: New-age tech companies have seen significant growth in CY24. Two stocks have surged over 100%. Newly listed companies have also shown strong gains. These tech-driven startups focus on fast-growing sectors and leverage advanced technologies to offer distinctive products and services. They are recognized for their rapid expansion, high market valuations, and ability to disrupt traditional industries.

items.title: Breakout Stocks: How to trade BASF India, Astrazeneca Pharma and Coforge on Tuesday?
items.description: Indian market closed in the red for the sixth consecutive day in a row on Monday weighed down by weak global cues.The S&P BSE Sensex fell more than 500 points while the Nifty50 closed below 24,900 levels.

items.title: Bajaj Finance, Persistent Systems among 5 stocks with short covering
items.description: Short covering happens when traders buy back shares they previously sold short, often due to a shift in market sentiment or new information. This usually results in a decrease in open interest and can drive the stock price higher. In Monday's trading session, five stocks saw short covering. Here's the list:
